level.heading: Temporary Legislation
level.text: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 804(a) of Multiyear Budget Spending Reduction and Support Temporary Act of 1995 (D.C. Law 10-253, March 23, 1995, law notification 42 DCR 1652).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) repeal of section, see § 8004 of Fiscal Year 2013 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-383, June 19, 2012, 59 DCR 7764).
For temporary (90 day) repeal of section, see § 8004 of Fiscal Year 2013 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-413, July 25, 2012, 59 DCR 9290).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-50
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 8-50, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 48-901.02.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-138
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 8-138, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 48-904.03a.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 9-123
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 9-123, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 48-907.03.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 9-155
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 9-155, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 48-907.03.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-52
level.text: Law 11-52, the "Omnibus Budget Support Act of 1995," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-218, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 19, 1995, and June 6, 1995, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 13, 1995, it was assigned Act No. 11-94 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-52 became effective on September 26, 1995.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-168
level.text: Law 19-168, the "Fiscal Year 2013 Budget Support Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-743. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 15, 2012, and June 5, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 22, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-385 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-168 became effective on September 20, 2012.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 8010 of D.C. Law 19-168 provided that §§ 8002, 8003, 8004, 8005, 8006, and 8007 of the act shall apply as of September 14, 2011.
